definition: precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart

sentences.english: Have a both husband and wife the old age son, see as the darling a baby.
sentences.chinese: 有一家夫妻倆老年得子，視爲心肝寶貝。

sentences.english: Our baby is a perfect darling.
sentences.chinese: 這嬰兒是全家的心肝寶貝。

sentences.english: I wanna know. Where is my baby?
sentences.chinese: 我想要知道我的心肝寶貝在哪兒。

sentences.english: The little girl was the apple of her daddy's eye.
sentences.chinese: 這小女孩是她爸爸的心肝寶貝。

sentences.english: Does your high-school sweetheart still talk about you?
sentences.chinese: 你高中時期的心肝寶貝還在談論你嗎？

sentences.english: The child soon became a precious thing to him.
sentences.chinese: 很快地，這小孩就成了他的心肝寶貝。

sentences.english: This woman is the apple of his eye to him.
sentences.chinese: 這個女人可真是他的心肝寶貝。

sentences.english: Every one of the quintuplets are their darlings.
sentences.chinese: 五胞胎個個是他們的心肝寶貝。

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to whisper to one another's ear
major turning point of lifelong import (esp. marriage)
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
success across the board/victory in everything one touches
adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
